intro: Paepalanthus orthogonalis, commonly known as the orthogonial puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, grass-like appearance with narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous small, colorful flowers arranged in a dense cluster. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
